title: The Week’s Most Interesting Reads
text:
A father’s grief and the Made in USA bomb dropped in Yemen. Bethan McKernan reports on the U.S.-made cluster bomb that killed a young Yemeni girl.

Trump and money are shielding Saudi Arabia from accountability for Khashoggi’s killing. Ben Freeman and William Hartung describe the role of many lobbying groups and the Trump administration in covering for the crown prince’s crimes.

Indigenous languages are in danger of going extinct around the world. Kayla Stewart explains how abusive and discriminatory treatment of indigenous peoples in many countries are contributing to the destruction of their languages.
